setTimecourseValue

public void setTimecourseValue(String name,
                               double val)
Description copied from interface: DataCollector
Append the given value to the named timecourse. Note it's important to keep all timecourses in sync by calling this once for each timecourse when a sample is recorded.

Specified by:
setTimecourseValue in interface DataCollector
Parameters:
name - the String name of the timecourse
val - the double value to append

writeSample

public void writeSample(String s)
Description copied from interface: DataCollector
Record a String, which should represent the complete state of the chain. Should be used exclusively by implementations of MonteCarloState.writeToDataCollector().

Specified by:
writeSample in interface DataCollector
Parameters:
s - the String to record

writeLatestTrajectoryValues

public void writeLatestTrajectoryValues()
Store the current trajectory values. This is distinct from setTimecourse because we need to set all the timecourse values first and only then write them all out on one line.
